history.content:
I was making this same decision myself. Asking around on facebook groups, that course combination is certainly doable. It might be a challenge, but then again, everything else is, too. 

EE16AB certainly helps, but it's not a prerequisite. (You can read more about the topics covered in CS 70 here: https://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/~cs70/fa14/. As you can see, they're not directly built upon EE16AB course material, although of course all of the subjects we are learning can be related somehow.)

In any event, EE16AB prepares you in terms of thinking strategy and course load more than the information itself. If you're doing well right now, then go ahead and go for it. 

Ultimately, it's up to you. As we've been told over and over again, "college is a marathon, not a sprint." Don't feel pressured to take the classes if you don't want to. But if you do want to try it out, then by all means, sign up for it now. If it ends up working out, then great - completing the CS 70 and 61B prerequisites will open up a bunch of cool upper divs that we're not allowed to take now. If not, then you can always drop the class and try again the next semester.

children.subject: I took CS 70 this semester as a freshman and I haven't taken any EE at all yet. I would argue that I did decently well in the class (fingers crossed for final grades) but I would strongly suggest having some kind of Berkeley math experience before taking it to help you understand the style of the class better. That being said, given that you've taken 53 and EE 16A already and you feel mostly comfortable in both classes, I would recommend taking the course whenever it fits your schedule!

history.content:
I'm a freshman EECS major trying to decide whether or not to take CS70 for spring. I get conflicting advice on whether or not I should. On the one hand, I hear that it's more manageable to take CS70 alongside 61B rather than alongside 61C. On the other hand, I hear that that I should finish EE16A/B before 70. Thoughts?

Background: This semester I took Math 53, EE16A and CS61A; next semester I will be taking EE16B, CS61B, and either CS70 or Physics 7B.
history.subject: CS70 or not? I get conflicting advice.
